msContents.summary: A long and formal notarial contract, recording an agreement, between two parties, one of which was most probably Theodoros, son of Obodianos. The exact purpose remains unclear but expressions relating to slaves recur often.

msItemStruct.note: Written transversa charta. Bottom margin ca. 5 cm and right margin ranges from 1.5 cm to almost nothing. Probably around ten different hands can be recognized. The main scribe wrote the body of the document using a large, upright cursive. In addition there are subscriptions of two contracting parties (both medium-sized, right-sloping cursives), the signatures of probably six witnesses and the signature of a notary
